org.sidoh.wwf_api
Class Communication

java.lang.Object
  org.sidoh.wwf_api.Communication

public class Communication
extends java.lang.Object

Responsible for sending pre-formatted requests to Zynga's servers and returning the raw results.

getGameIndex

public java.io.Reader getGameIndex(java.lang.String authToken)
Get a list of all recent games, including those that have already completed. The number of games that is returned by this call is controlled by Zynga.

Parameters:
authToken -
Returns:

getGameState

public java.io.Reader getGameState(long gameId,
                                   java.lang.String authToken)
Fetch full data about a particular game. One should be able to reconstruct the game state given the data returned by this call.

Parameters:
gameId -
authToken -
Returns:

dictionaryLookup

public java.io.Reader dictionaryLookup(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> words,
                                       java.lang.String authToken)
Check which of the provided words are contained in the WWF dictionary. Note that there exist words in the ENABLE1 dictionary that are not in the WWF dictionary. Likewise, some valid WWF words are not in the ENABLE1 dictionary.

Parameters:
words -
authToken -
Returns:

makeMove

public java.io.Reader makeMove(java.lang.String authToken,
                                params)
Submit a move for a particular game. The params for this call should be built using RequestGenerator.

Parameters:
authToken -
params - move submission params -- use RequestGenerator to build this
Returns:

createRandomGame

public java.io.Reader createRandomGame(java.lang.String authToken)
Creates a random (matchmaking) game. Sometimes you'll be matched with another player immediately. Other times, you'll be matched within a few minutes of creating a new game.

Parameters:
authToken -
Returns:
